pullrequest.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

content.raw: For fun, here's a [sample](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RNWYvZBLyqE) of the types of parameters one can control over gzclient GUI with this pull request.
content.html: For fun, here's a sample of the types of parameters one can control over gzclient GUI with this pull request.

pull_request.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

update.description:
* Allow setting various ODE PGS options via parameters.
 * Add various ODE PGS parameters pass through to gzclient GUI.
 * Update `GetParam` and `SetParam` for `ODEPhysics` and `SimbodyPhysics` for various parameters.
 * Update and add various ODE error metrics (bilateral, normal, frictional, etc)
 * Add energy (kinetic and potential) calculation in absolute world frame for Links and Models.
 * Update `Joint::ComputeInertiaRatio` to compute ratio across user specified axis.
 * Add `test/integration/pgs_test.cpp` to test various new PGS options used for VRC.
 * Remove `world/stacks.world` - it has no inertia info.  added `test/worlds/sphere_stack.world` with inertia info.
 * Split `physics.proto` into physics engine specific parameter messages.

[Jenkins coverage build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-coverage-quantal-amd64/39/) Mar 20, 2014 11:48:08 AM
update.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

pull_request.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

pullrequest.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

content.raw:
I'll strip physics proto message changes:

  1. recover `physics.proto`
  1. remove new tests in ODEPhysics_TEST.cc
  1. recover `ModelListWidget.cc`, disable ability to change options dynamically
  1. Recover PhysicsEngine.cc changes that allows for physics option changes except for the change from `void SetParam` to `bool SetParam`.
  1. strip physics options from documentations in `PhysicsEngine.hh`
  1. recover original `ODEPhysics_TEST.cc`, stripped of new tests
  1. remove `pgs_tests.cc`
  1. remove references to simbody options in `gz.cc` and recover `gz_TEST.cc`
  1. remove energy calculations in Link
  1. remove energy calculations in Model

such that API is not broken.
content.html:
I'll strip physics proto message changes:

  1. recover physics.proto
  2. remove new tests in ODEPhysics_TEST.cc
  3. recover ModelListWidget.cc, disable ability to change options dynamically
  4. Recover PhysicsEngine.cc changes that allows for physics option changes except for the change from void SetParam to bool SetParam.
  5. strip physics options from documentations in PhysicsEngine.hh
  6. recover original ODEPhysics_TEST.cc, stripped of new tests
  7. remove pgs_tests.cc
  8. remove references to simbody options in gz.cc and recover gz_TEST.cc
  9. remove energy calculations in Link
  10. remove energy calculations in Model

such that API is not broken.

content.raw:
+1 keeping custom messages for bullet, dart, ode and simbody for now.

alternatively, we can have array of key strings and arrays of values, but
how do we declare arrays of values that could potentially have different
types?
content.html:
+1 keeping custom messages for bullet, dart, ode and simbody for now.

alternatively, we can have array of key strings and arrays of values, but how do we declare arrays of values that could potentially have different types?

pull_request.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

pullrequest.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

content.raw:
I initially created #1028 to discuss this, and I agree that it is not a great solution right now. Do you have any ideas?

Are going to give up on declaring variable types? Do we want a free-for-all like there is for plugin sdf tags?

I think having custom messages won't make sense for the plugin api, but it seems reasonable for the 4 physics engines with built-in support, at least as a stopgap until we figure out something better. It will be really helpful for the ASME results to be able to modify these parameters at run-time.
content.html:
I initially created #1028 to discuss this, and I agree that it is not a great solution right now. Do you have any ideas?

Are going to give up on declaring variable types? Do we want a free-for-all like there is for plugin sdf tags?

I think having custom messages won't make sense for the plugin api, but it seems reasonable for the 4 physics engines with built-in support, at least as a stopgap until we figure out something better. It will be really helpful for the ASME results to be able to modify these parameters at run-time.

content.raw: I don't think this should go into gazebo 3.0. There are some major changes to the physics API, which are not needed for bullet to work.
content.html: I don't think this should go into gazebo 3.0. There are some major changes to the physics API, which are not needed for bullet to work.

pull_request.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

pullrequest.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

content.raw: Having separate message for each physics engine will not scale. This is essentially spreading the physics api outside of the physics library into message passing, and the tools. I'm not sure we should do this.
content.html: Having separate message for each physics engine will not scale. This is essentially spreading the physics api outside of the physics library into message passing, and the tools. I'm not sure we should do this.

pull_request.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

pullrequest.title: clean up ode code.  pass through some parameters used in vrc.

content.raw: `accuracy` and `max-transient-velocity` are not defined in boost options. They are also only valid for a specific engine. Another command line option should be added to specify the engine, and then error checking should be done to make sure the correct engine is matched with the correct engine param.
content.html: accuracy and max-transient-velocity are not defined in boost options. They are also only valid for a specific engine. Another command line option should be added to specify the engine, and then error checking should be done to make sure the correct engine is matched with the correct engine param.

content.html:
I am tempted to deprecate

      public: virtual void SetParam(ODEParam _param,
                  const boost::any &_value);
      public: virtual boost::any GetParam(ODEParam _param) const;

and use

      public: virtual void SetParam(const std::string &_key,
                  const boost::any &_value);
      public: virtual boost::any GetParam(const std::string &_key) const;

but I haven't addressed that in this pull request yet, given there's enough changes here.

From that perspective, I don't want to add more enums.

Thoughts?
